title: Isolate the Quadratic term
text: We minus $$3$$ on both sides to get $$2{\left(x-2\right)}^2$$ by itself which gives $$2{\left(x-2\right)}^2=54$$

title: Find Leading Coefficient
pacedSpeech: What's the leading coefficient now?

title: Make the Leading Coefficient "1"
text: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives $${\left(x-2\right)}^2=27$$.
speech: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives  parentheses x minus 2,  squared is equal to 27 .

title: Use Square Root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $${\left(x-2\right)}^2=27$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$x-2=\sqrt{27}$$ or $$x-2=-\sqrt{27}$$.

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$2{\left(x-2\right)}^2+3=57$$ has two solutions which are $$x=2-3\sqrt{3}$$, and $$x=2+3\sqrt{3}$$.
speech: Therefore,  2 times, parentheses x minus 2,  squared plus 3 is equal to 57  has two solutions which are  x, is equal to 2 minus, 3 the square root of 3 , and  x is equal to, 2 plus, 3 the square root of 3 .
